title.narrative: Mitigation Action Implementation Network (MAIN) II: Implementing Ambitious NAMAs in Latin America and Asia

description.narrative: The project supported emerging and developing countries in Latin America and Asia in designing ambitious NAMAs through technical cooperation and organization of national, regional and global workshops and dialogues on the development and implementation of NAMAs (transport, energy, and waste sectors). The project built on the work of another IKI project that established the MAIN Initiative and primarily dealt with the development of general NAMA knowledge. Existing NAMA approaches were further developed. Furthermore, the project garnered financial support for the implementation. Existing public finance institutions, including the Green Climate Fund (GCF), and donor country programs should be incorporated in the financing of NAMAs, along with the private sector. The NAMAs developed by the partner countries show that reducing GHG is compatible with economic development.

participating-org.narrative: Federal Ministry for the Environment, Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

mailing-address.narrative: IKI Secretariat, Zukunft - Umwelt - Gesellschaft (ZUG) gGmbH Köthener Straße 4, 10963 Berlin, Germany
